Package logistikoptimierung.Entities.FactoryObjects

Class FactoryConglomerate

java.lang.Object
logistikoptimierung.Entities.FactoryObjects.FactoryConglomerate
public class FactoryConglomerate extends Object
This class creates an object for the factory conglomerate. The factory conglomerate is the main object and contains the warehouse, transporters, drivers, and different factories. This class also starts the simulation.

  • Constructor Details

    • FactoryConglomerate

      public FactoryConglomerate​(String name, List<Factory> factories, List<Transporter> transporters, List<Material> suppliedMaterials, List<Product> availableProducts)
      This class creates an object for the factory conglomerate. The factory conglomerate is the main object and contains the warehouse, transporters, drivers, and different factories. This class also starts the simulation.
      Parameters:
      name - sets the name
      factories - sets the productions with the production processes
      transporters - sets the transporters
      suppliedMaterials - sets the materials for supply
      availableProducts - sets the available productions

  • Method Details

    • startSimulation

      public long startSimulation​(List<Order> orderList, List<FactoryStep> factorySteps, long maxRunTime)
      Starts the simulation. The simulation iterates and every step creates a new event time step. At every event time step the simulation tries to perform every task in the factory steps every iteration. The simulation stops if it reaches the max run time, if no factory step is left to perform or no event time step is left. The log settings sets the amount of messages which are printed in the console while the simulation. The not printed messages are stored in the object.
      Parameters:
      orderList - sets the orders
      factorySteps - sets the factory steps to perform
      maxRunTime - sets the maximum runtime after the simulation stops
      Returns:
      the time step after the factory stops (in seconds)

    • startSimulation

      public long startSimulation​(List<Order> orderList, List<FactoryStep> factorySteps, boolean checkIfMaterialIsAlreadyInWarehouse, long maxRunTime)
      Starts the simulation. The simulation iterates and every step creates a new event time step. At every event time step the simulation tries to perform every task in the factory steps every iteration. The simulation stops if it reaches the max run time, if no factory step is left to perform or no event time step is left. The log settings sets the amount of messages which are printed in the console while the simulation. The not printed messages are stored in the object.
      Parameters:
      orderList - sets the orders
      factorySteps - sets the factory steps to perform
      maxRunTime - sets the maximum runtime after the simulation stops
      checkIfMaterialIsAlreadyInWarehouse - checks if the materials is already in the warehouse for the step. If yes, the step will not be performed
      Returns:
      the time step after the factory stops (in seconds)

    • getNrOfRemainingSteps

      public int getNrOfRemainingSteps()
      Returns:
      returns after the simulation, if the max runtime is reached the nr of remaining steps

    • resetFactory

      public void resetFactory()
      Resets the factory and every factory object to its initial state.

      Parameters:

      sets the log settings for the factory
      Parameters:
      logSettings - sets the amount of printed messages in the console

    • getProductionProcessesForProduct

      public List<ProductionProcess> getProductionProcessesForProduct​(WarehouseItem product)
      Gets the every production processes for a specific product to produce.
      Parameters:
      product - the specific product to produce
      Returns:
      a list or production processes. Returns an empty list if no production process was found for the product.

    • getWarehousePositionsForProductWithRespectOfBatchSize

      public List<WarehousePosition> getWarehousePositionsForProductWithRespectOfBatchSize​(WarehouseItem product, int amount, boolean produceEverything)
      Gets the every warehouse item for the production processes for a specific product to produce with the respect of the batch size. The list contains every batch which needs to be produced to fulfill the amount of the product.
      Parameters:
      product - the product to produce
      amount - the amount needed for the product to produce
      produceEverything - true if everything gets produced also Stahl and Bauholz (both have also a supplier)
      Returns:
      list with warehouse position, empty list if no production process was found for the item.

    • getProductionProcessForProduct

      public ProductionProcess getProductionProcessForProduct​(Product item)
      Returns the production process for the product.
      Parameters:
      item - product
      Returns:
      the production process, null if no process was found

    • checkIfItemHasASupplier

      public boolean checkIfItemHasASupplier​(WarehouseItem item)
      Checks if the specific warehouse item (product or material) has a supplier.
      Parameters:
      item - warehouse item to check
      Returns:
      true if the item has a supplier, false if not

      Parameters:
      message - message to log
      factoryObjectType - the object which has the message

    • addFactoryStepLog

      public void addFactoryStepLog​(String message, LogMessageTypes factoryObjectType, boolean completed)
      adds a log message for a factory step to the factory and print the message in the console if the settings are set for the message
      Parameters:
      message - message to log
      factoryObjectType - the object which has the message
      completed - if the factory step was completed

    • addBlockLog

      public void addBlockLog​(String name, FactoryStepTypes stepType, LogMessageTypes factoryObjectType)
      adds a log message if a factory object was blocked for a task.
      Parameters:
      name - name of the factory object
      stepType - step type which the object wanted to perform
      factoryObjectType - type of the factory object

    • printAllLogMessage

      public void printAllLogMessage()
      prints every log message

    • printLogMessageFromTo

      public void printLogMessageFromTo​(long fromTimeStamp, long toTimeStamp)
      prints every log message in the time between the from and to time step
      Parameters:
      fromTimeStamp - start for the messages
      toTimeStamp - end for the messages

    • getWorkingOrderForOrder

      public Order getWorkingOrderForOrder​(Order order)
      Returns the working order which is used for storing the state of the current order for the specific order
      Parameters:
      order - for which the working order is needed
      Returns:
      the working order, returns null if the order was not found
